channel.title: Help with mining

item.title: Help with mining
item.dc:creator: @mmaKush mmaKush
item.description:
@mmaKush wrote:

aplwanabes:

wth is a loop? lol

If you don’t know what the basics of the Java programming language are, don’t try editing, let alone making a server. Go read some java tutorials or watch some youtube videos.

http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/index.html

The for statement provides a compact way to iterate over a range of values. Programmers often refer to it as the “for loop” because of the way in which it repeatedly loops until a particular condition is satisfied.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with mining
item.dc:creator: @mmaKush mmaKush
item.description:
@mmaKush wrote:

How would i make it so mining doesnt take so long for 1 ore and how would i make it keep mineing til inventory is full? lol this is what part of mineing code is.

  1. Create a timer for that object ID so when you click the object, (FirstClickObject packet) he’ll do specific emote, if you’ve used one, and mine the ore using that pre-set time.

  2. Use a loop.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with mining
item.dc:creator: @aplwanabes aplwanabes
item.description:
@aplwanabes wrote:

	/*
	 * 
	 * MINING
	 * 
	 */

	case 2491:
		pEmote = 0x554;
		startEssMine(2491);
		break;

	case 2090:
	case 2091:
		// copper rock
			pEmote = 0x554;
		mining[0] = 1;
		mining[1] = 1;
		if (misc.random(2) == 1) {
			mining[2] = 35;
		} else {
			mining[2] = 35;
		}
		mining[4] = 436;
		break;

	case 2094:
	case 2095:
		// tin rock
			pEmote = 0x554;
		mining[0] = 1;
		mining[1] = 1;
		if (misc.random(2) == 1) {
			mining[2] = 35;
		} else {
			mining[2] = 35;
		}
		mining[4] = 438;
		break;

	case 2110:
		// blurite rock
			pEmote = 0x554;
		mining[0] = 2;
		mining[1] = 10;
		if (misc.random(2) == 1) {
			mining[2] = 35;
		} else {
			mining[2] = 35;
		}
		mining[4] = 668;
		break;

	case 4028:
	case 4029:
	case 4030:
		// lime rock
			pEmote = 0x554;
		mining[0] = 1;
		mining[1] = 1;
		if (misc.random(2) == 1) {
			mining[2] = 53;
		} else {
			mining[2] = 53;
		}
		mining[4] = 3211;
		break;

	case 2092:
	case 2093:
		// iron rock
			pEmote = 0x554;
		mining[0] = 2;
		mining[1] = 15;
		mining[2] = 70;
		mining[4] = 440;
		break;

	case 2100:
	case 2101:
	case 11187:
		if(action == 1){
		// silver rock
			pEmote = 0x554;
		mining[0] = 4;
		mining[1] = 1;
		mining[2] = 80;
		mining[4] = 442;
		}
		break;

	case 3403:
		// elemental rock
			pEmote = 0x554;
		mining[0] = 4;
		mining[1] = 20;
		mining[2] = 20;
		mining[4] = 2892;
		break;

	case 2096:
	case 2097:
		// coal rock
			pEmote = 0x554;
		mining[0] = 5;
		mining[1] = 30;
		mining[2] = 100;
		mining[4] = 453;
		break;

	/*
	 * GEM ROCK case : case : //gem rock mining[0] = 6; mining[1] = 40;
	 * mining[2] = 130; mining[4] = Item.randomSGems(); break;
	 */
	case 2102:
	case 2103:
		// mithril rock
			pEmote = 0x554;
		mining[0] = 10;
		mining[1] = 55;
		mining[2] = 160;
		mining[4] = 447;
		break;

	case 2104:
	case 2105:
		// adamant rock
			pEmote = 0x554;
			mining[0] = 15;
			mining[1] = 70;
			mining[2] = 190;
			mining[4] = 449;
		break;

	case 2106:
	case 2107:
	case 14859:
	case 14860:
		// rune rock
			pEmote = 0x554;
			mining[0] = 32;
			mining[1] = 85;
			mining[2] = 250;
			mining[4] = 451;
		break;

	default:
		GoFalse = true;
		break;
	}
	if (GoFalse == true) {
		return false;
	}
	return true;
}

How would i make it so mining doesnt take so long for 1 ore and how would i make it keep mineing til inventory is full? lol this is what part of mineing code is.
